intro: Castilleja austromontana, commonly known as the mountain milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its roots form symbiotic relationships with certain fungi, which aid in nutrient absorption. Castilleja austromontana is often found in association with other flowering plants, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
